body.p: To His Excellency Tho E. Bramblette Governor of Kentucky

Your Petetioner Wm Maloney and wife would respectfully represent that at the September Term 1864 of the Nicholas Circuit Court they were fined by the Judgement of said Court the sum of Sixty Dollars each upon an indictment for keeping a "Tipling House"

They are very poor, have a large family, and are not able to pay the whole of said fines, -- They have but lately become denigens of the United States. and the Teachings of this lesson upon the subject of the laws of the Country, shall not be lost upon them, and in the future they promise an honest obedience to the laws -- They pray your Excellency to remit said fines in so far as he has power to do so & as in duty bound they will ever humbly pray,

The Undersigned citizens of Nicholas County 'Ky say they are acquainted with Wm Maloney & wife, Petitioners above, and with their circumstances & the facts & circumstances of the case in which they ^were^ fined as set forth in their Petition, and unhesitatingly join them in the prayer that the fines be remitted,

W. W. Howard Clk Nicholas Cir. Ct.
Jno A. Campbell clk. County Ct.
R J R Tilton
W. P. Ross
Fitch Munger
Thomas Kennedy
John, M, Chevis
Peyton S Adair

Nicholas Cir Ct
vs R A Jacobs
Wm Maloney & wife
